Guest has said the victim was waiting outside the courthouse with his lawyer and was expected to appear in court on drug charges.

ldc_extent.charseq: There is a heavy police presence at a county courthouse in Mississippi where there have been several unconfirmed reports of a fatal shooting.
Fifteen police vehicles are on the scene at the red-brick criminal courthouse for Madison County in Canton.

extent.charseq: (AP) -- The latest on a fatal shooting outside a Mississippi courthouse (all times local): 11:25 a.m.
An official has identified the victim in a fatal shooting outside a Mississippi courthouse.
According to an indictment forwarded to The Associated Press by Madison County District Attorney Michael Guest, the victim in the Monday morning shooting was Kendrick Armond Brown.
Madison County District Attorney Michael Guest
Guest has said the victim was waiting outside the courthouse with his lawyer and was expected to appear in court on drug charges.
Guest says prosecutors expected that the victim would reject a plea offer and the judge would then set the case for trial.
A suspect has been arrested and is in custody in the county jail.
A suspect has been arrested and is in custody in the county jail.
Both Guest and Madison County Sheriff Randy Tucker have said they don't know why the suspect would have shot the other man.
Guest says the victim was not a witness or a suspect in other current criminal cases.
A law enforcement official says a man fatally shot a defendant waiting outside a Mississippi courthouse Monday morning.
Madison County sheriff Randy Tucker says a suspect has been arrested and is in custody in the Madison County jail.
Madison County sheriff Randy Tucker says a suspect has been arrested and is in custody in the Madison County jail.
Tucker declined to identify the man arrested or the man shot.
Tucker declined to identify the man arrested or the man shot.
The shooting happened in a small courtyard outside Madison County's criminal courthouse in Canton.
Tucker says the suspect fired one shot with a semiautomatic handgun, and the defendant was shot once in the chest and died at the scene.
